p: In vitro antiplasmodial results were interpreted as follows: high activity (IC 50 ≤ 10 μg/ml), moderate activity (IC 50 of 11-50 μg/ml), low activity (IC 50 of 50-100 μg/ml), and inactive (IC 50 of ≥100 μg/ml) [ 20], and are summarized in Table 2. In this study, out of all the aqueous and organic extracts of the studied plants that were tested against both D6 (CQ-sensitive) and W2 (CQ-resistant) strains of P. falciparum, 24% exhibited high activity (IC 50 ≤ 1 0 μg/ml), 43% moderate activity (IC 50 of 11-50 μg/ml), 18% low activity (IC 50 of 50-100 μg/ml), and 15% were inactive (IC 50 ≥ 100 μg/ml) ( Table 2).
